thread.title: Boston Red Sox' Xander Bogaerts 6 hits from 200; Does he or Mookie Betts have a brighter future? POLL
thread.title_full: Boston Red Sox' Xander Bogaerts 6 hits from 200; Does he or Mookie Betts have a brighter future? POLL

author: Christopher Smith | csmith@masslive.com
title: Boston Red Sox' Xander Bogaerts 6 hits from 200; Does he or Mookie Betts have a brighter future? POLL
text:
Email newsletters comments Boston Red Sox' Xander Bogaerts 6 hits from 200; Does he or Mookie Betts have a brighter future? POLL Xander Bogaerts Boston Red Sox's Xander Bogaerts hits an RBI double in the seventh inning against the Tampa Bay Rays earlier this season. (AP Photo/Steven Senne) 
CLEVELAND â€” The Boston Red Sox will play their final series of the 2015 season today through Sunday here at Progressive Field against Terry Francona's Indians. 
Xander Bogaerts is six hits away from 200. 
The shortstop is batting .322 with a .356 on-base percentage, .423 slugging percentage, .779 OPS, seven homers, 34 doubles ands 81 RBIs. 
Bogaerts is second in the AL batting title race behind Detroit's Miguel Cabrera who is hitting .334. 
Houston's Jose Altuve and Cleveland's Michael Brantley, who both are batting .310, are behind Bogaerts tied for third. 
The emergence of Mookie Betts also has been a major storyline this year. 
Betts is batting .297/.345/.488/.833 with 18 homers, 77 RBIs, 42 doubles and eight triples. 
Betts actually has a better WAR (wins above replacement) than Bogaerts. Betts' WAR is 4.9 while Bogaerts' WAR is 4.4 . 
Bogaert's and Betts are the only two Red Sox players with a WAR over 4.0 (and 3.0) this year. 
RED SOX FRIDAY LINEUP
